title: Toast Notifications
description: Toasts are non-intrusive notifications that appear briefly to provide feedback or information to the user, then disappear automatically.

overview.title: Overview of Toast Notifications
overview.description: Toasts are used to show brief, auto-expiring messages for actions like 'Message Sent' or 'File Saved'. They shouldn't interrupt the user's workflow and are typically displayed at the top or bottom of the screen.

html.title: HTML Structure
html.description: The HTML requires a trigger element (like a button) and a container element, usually with a fixed position, where the toast messages will be dynamically added and removed.

css.title: CSS Styling
css.description: CSS is used to style the toast's appearance and position. Animations or transitions are crucial for a smooth entry and exit (e.g., fade in and fade out), which are controlled by adding and removing classes.

js.title: JavaScript Logic
js.description: The JavaScript creates a new toast element on a trigger event, appends it to the container, and uses a `setTimeout` to remove the toast from the DOM after a few seconds.

quiz.title: Toast Quiz
quiz.description: Test your knowledge on toast notifications.
